definition: to govern/to control/having jurisdiction over/linchpin of a wheel (archaic)/noise of a barrow
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
sentences.chinese: 求你用你的话，使我脚步稳当，不许什么罪孽辖制我。

sentences.english: And all day long my name is constantly blasphemed .
sentences.chinese: 辖制他们的人呼叫，我的名整天受亵渎。

sentences.english: You need to use such knowledge but not to be ruled by it.
sentences.chinese: 你需要使用这些知识，但是不能被其所辖制。

sentences.english: Appoint an evil man to oppose him; let an accuser stand at his right hand.
sentences.chinese: 愿你派一个恶人辖制他，派一个对头站在他右边。

sentences.english: Believers are free from the law's curse, its penalty, and its guilt-producing power.
sentences.chinese: 信徒不再受到律法的咒诅，刑罚和罪咎感的辖制。

sentences.english: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.
sentences.chinese: 愿你派一个恶人辖制他，派一个对头站在他右边。

sentences.english: In God's sight, that old nature is no longer reigning over us.
sentences.chinese: 在神的眼中，我们不再受旧人的辖制。

definition: forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
variant of 撒旦[Sa1 dan4], Satan or Shaitan
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
